Authors: Enrico Ercole, Claudio Angelini, Alfredo Vizzini
Title:
A new Neopaxillus species (Agaricomycetes) from the Dominican
Republic, and the status of Neopaxillus within the Agaricales
Keywords:
Central America, Crepidotoid clade, Paxillaceae,
Serpulaceae, Simocybe, Mexico, taxonomy
Abstract:
A new species of Neopaxillus, viz.Â N. dominicanus, is
reported from the Dominican Republic. It is well circumscribed by having
a basidiome with decurrent and distant white gills with evident
pink-lilac tinges at maturity, well developed cheilocystidia, and
echinulate globose spores. The study includes a description, color
photographs of fresh basidiomes and line drawings of relevant
microscopic traits. N. dominicanus is very close to Neopaxillus
echinospermus, the type species of the genus Neopaxillus. Based on
comparative ITS-LSU rDNA gene sequence analyses, Neopaxillus, a genus
formerly placed in Boletales, is considered within Agaricales and where
it is sister to Crepidotus (Crepidotaceae).
